channel.title: What Compression do i need to extract files on hostgator file manager?
channel.description:
i am a website developer and i upload each file which takes a long time
in 00webhost you can upload a .zip and the .zip auto extracts into the file manager.
but in hostgator the .zip dont auto extract the same??? does anyone know a file i could use that does work like this???

item.title: What Compression do i need to extract files on hostgator file manager?
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

.zip works on hostgator

Read full topic

item.title: What Compression do i need to extract files on hostgator file manager?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

You’re right about that one. Ever since I left PHP, I haven’t really seen any need, for myself, to use FTP.

It’s mainly been ruby -> git -> heroku haha.

item.title: What Compression do i need to extract files on hostgator file manager?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

I couldn’t even go back to FTP or SSH since just using version control for everything. You can even get mercurial running on these shitty hosts as long as they support python.
